main.name: Toni Sánchez
main.description: I am Toni Sánchez, a Developer in love with JavaScript, MERN stack and my dog Lennon.
main.bioWhat: I develop engaging, modern and extremely automated digital products, such as mobile, web and desktop applications as well as GraphQL API and REST API, my mantra: "Scalable, Reusable, Maintainable". I achieve scalability and reusability by separating the "UI" from the "data" as far as possible and beyond. I succeed on making it maintainable by always working with TDD approach, trying to become better at testing that I am at coding. Full Stack skills, from designing a fresh prototype with Sketch to develop with React, querying mongodb, creating back end API with Node to programming a server with Express. I still don't have a favorite field yet, as long as I can use React on a daily basis.
main.bioHow: Passionate about functional programming. I am not scared of using mathematical thinking. My mind thinks in JavaScript, my stack is MERN, but I choose to live the JS fatigue, always ready for next framework. Android/iOS apps with React Native, desktop apps with Electron JS or Java. I can work with jQuery instead of React or complementing it, PHP instead of Node, Python instead of Java and SQL instead of Mongo, although I would not choose that stack and therefore I am not that creative with it as with MERN.
main.bioWhen: All applications listed on this site (included this site, ha) are developed with React. Despite earlier versions of a+Eco REST API that where querying SQL with PHP in the back, earlier versions and the rest of the applications are querying mongoDB using Node. There is no scalability without Redux, I implement it 99% of the cases, even when the project looks apparently small. Last, and less important, I also tend to work with SASS or other pre-processors when project gets too big.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: This list was intentionally left incomplete, showing the most relevant skills.

education.description: Completed courses: Full Stack Open. MongoDB, Express, React, Node. (9 ECTS), Full Stack Open Project (10 ECTS), Introduction to Programming. Java I. (5 ECTS), Advanced Programming. Java II. (5 ECTS), DevOps with Docker (3 ECTS), Elements and Building AI (5 ECTS)
Completed courses: Accounting I, Mathematics I, Microeconomics I, Macroeconomics I, Business Economics, Statistics & Data Analysis I, International Law I.

certifications.name: C100DEV: Certified Developer
certifications.description: C100DEV Exam + M001, M103, M121, M220, M201 and M320 courses. Philosophy & Features: performance, JSON, BSON, fault tolerance, disaster recovery, horizontal scaling, and the Mongo shell CRUD: Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations Data Modeling: embedding, references, document growth, modeling one-to-one and one-to-many relationships, modeling for atomic operations, modeling tree structures Indexing and Performance: single key, compound, multi-key, mechanics, storage engines, and performance Aggregation: pipeline, operators, memory usage, sort, skip, and limit Replication: configuration, oplog concepts, write concern, elections, failover, and deployment to multiple data centers Sharding: components, when to shard, balancing, shard keys, and hashed shard keys.

certifications.name: Professional Collaboration Engineer
certifications.description: A Professional Collaboration Engineer transforms business objectives into tangible configurations, policies, and security practices as they relate to users, content, and integrations. Collaboration Engineers leverage their understanding of their organization’s mail routing and identity management infrastructure to enable efficient and secure communication and data access. Operating with an engineering and solutions mindset, they use tools, programming languages, and APIs to automate workflows. They look for opportunities to educate end users and increase operational efficiency while advocating for G Suite and the Google toolset.

certifications.name: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
certifications.description: The AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner examination is intended for individuals who have the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively demonstrate an overall understanding of the AWS Cloud, independent of specific technical roles addressed by other AWS Certifications.

certifications.name: 98-383: HTML & CSS
certifications.description: Exam venue: PUE, Barcelona on August 23, 2019 at 11:00am, language: English. Microsoft Technology Associate in Programming with HTML & CSS.

certifications.name: MOS Excel 2016 Expert
certifications.description: Exam venue: PUE, Barcelona on September 13th, 2019 at 11:00am, language: English. Microsoft Excel 2016 Expert Certification exam earners have an advanced understanding of Excel 2016, and create, manage, and distribute professional spreadsheets for a variety of specialized purposes. They customize their Excel environments and enhance productivity in custom business templates, multiple-axis financial charts, amortization tables, and inventory schedules. Excel earners include accountants, financial analysts, data analysts, and commercial bankers.

certifications.name: MOS Excel 2016
certifications.description: Exam venue: PUE, Barcelona on August 2, 2019 at 11:00am, language: English. Microsoft Excel 2016 Certification exam earners have a fundamental understanding of Excel 2016 and the ability to complete tasks independently. Earners have proven they can create and edit a workbook with multiple sheets, and use graphic elements to represent data visually including professional-looking budgets, financial statements, performance charts, and data-entry logs. Excel earners include students, business professionals, clerical workers, bookkeepers, educators, and others.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: Working with several marketing and design agencies, coding for different free open source applications, UI/UX kits, React templates, modern websites and web browser extensions. Blogged about React and modern development on Medium, Dev.to, reactSavvy and others. The 4 most recent coding projects can be found on portfolio section.

work.title: Senior Front End Developer
work.description: Adapting mock ups and designs coming from the Marketing Department into scalable and reusable code for 3 different products, using React with Redux. Ocasionally collaborating with the development of the API as part of a team. The main products of eEvidence consist of email and files certification using cryptography, to be used as a legal proof or for protecting Intellectual Property rights following international standards. With about 14K users in 121 countries using the service, from small companies to international banks.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: Releasing full version in 2021. Web/Mobile/Desktop app. Fully automated accounting/taxation suite for freelancers and small companies. OCR (optical character recognition) to detect and automate accounting and tax processes, and many other tools. Integration with Sage®, A3eco®, Quickbooks® and many others. Server programmed with Node using Express. All CRUD operations querying MongoDB. Scalable and reusable front end built with React and tested with Jest. E2E testing with Cypress.
work.achievements: Building the first accounting suite with fully customisable interface, developed the first free API to encode/decode a3Eco software files as an altenative to the official paid application.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: Developing a web application for accounting processes automation in the IT department of a legal Firm specialised in automated accounting and taxation.
work.achievements: Personally developed API with Node to automate accounting entries of more than 4,000 yearly Skrill online payments in different currencies that were processed manually by accountants. Personally developed API in Node to automate more than 10,000 yearly Paypal online payments in different currencies that were processed manually by accountants. Personally developed CRUD Application with MERN to use own DB and automate accounting entries of different format csv and xls files that were previously made with expensive external software, personally developed API in Node to automate Bank conciliations that was previously made with expensive external software.

projects.title: ticktax.io
projects.bio: ticktax.io is an accounting and taxation software. This CRUD application has the goal of automating all the processes of an accounting firm that deals with small companies and freelancers. The number of future features is infinite. The features available right now are: automatic bank conciliation, bookkeeping automation, integration with a3Eco and SAGE, and many more.

projects.title: dokey
projects.bio: Dokey docs is an API Docs generator built with React, JSS and Node. The user can build responsive software documentation sites without coding in just minutes.

projects.title: reactSavvy
projects.bio: reactSavvy.com is a Blog built from scratch with React, meaning pure coding, without using Wordpress or other third party solutions. The blog addresses advanced topics for Professional React Developers. With the goal of helping debugging React code and document daily issues and bugs when professionally working with React. All posts are written by me, Toni Sánchez.

projects.title: tonisanchez.dev
projects.bio: tonisanchez.dev is a personal portfolio website built with React. The source code has been later used to develope future UI/UX kits as well as React landing page templates. Is a responsive design, very simple and minimalistic and all components are reusable, all the data is stored in a JSON file and passed as props to the React functional components, separating the UI from the data.
